channel.title: Finding a host that won't shut our server/website down
channel.description:
My team and I are almost done with our server development but now we are having difficulty's with finding a host that won't shut us down. we wan't to start with a windows vps around 25$/month max we thought about offshore hosting but most seem unreliable. If any of you know a host offshore/onshore that won't shut us down for hosting a rsps/webclient please let me know.
Thank you.

item.title: Finding a host that won't shut our server/website down
item.dc:creator: @Team_Rocket Team_Rocket
item.description:
@Team_Rocket wrote:

[quote=“pro banana, post:9, topic:452446”][quote author=Team_Rocket link=topic=555326.msg4066311#msg4066311 date=1343922440]

One problem is that Jagex is very threatening. I mean come on, why would your providers risk a possible lawsuit with a large company? Jagex will make false accusations to your providers and will actually frighten most into doing what they want.

That’s the thing I don’t want a host that goes like this: “Oh noez we haz to protect our super original professional company.” when they see a rsps running on their servers.

Call the company and ask a lot of questions. Record the conversation. You should always feel them out before you purchase ANYTHING.
[/quote]

Will do, I really appreciate the advice guys thanks![/quote]

You’re quite welcome. I’m sure others will have more to add as well.

Read full topic
item.source: Finding a host that won't shut our server/website down

item.source: Finding a host that won't shut our server/website down

item.title: Finding a host that won't shut our server/website down
item.dc:creator: @pro_banana pro banana
item.description:
@pro_banana wrote:

[quote=“Team_Rocket, post:3, topic:452446”][quote author=Whackatre link=topic=555326.msg4065997#msg4065997 date=1343889533]
Because private servers are open source, copyright infringement cannot (or should not?) be a problem. Jagex did not write private server code and therefore cannot claim that it is theirs. The only possible way for Jagex to shut your host down is that they can state that that some Java program on your computer just happens to be compatible with their RS(317?) client which just so happens to be on your website.

Read MITB’s discussion with Jagex’s lawyers. One of his points centered on the usage of links. Do not host the client on your webhost; instead, externally link it.

If anybody had past experiences with Jagex that proves my points false, please tell me about it.
[/quote]

What you’ve said is correct. There are no false statements in what you’ve said.

@OP: There are way too many loopholes to worry about Jagex shutting you down.[/quote]

I’m glad to hear this but I’m not scared of jagex really I just don’t wan’t my host to shut me down just like that.
Like Iv’e heard that x10hosting auto shuts you down when hosting a webclient/server on their VPS’s.

@Ruby they seem decent enough thanks ;d

I’m glad I made this post this very reassuring to me.

Read full topic
item.source: Finding a host that won't shut our server/website down

item.title: Finding a host that won't shut our server/website down
item.dc:creator: @Ruby_Forums_Coder Ruby
item.description:
@Ruby_Forums_Coder wrote:

I use softsyshosting, they’re cheap and great.

Jagex have too many loopholes in their contracts for us to slip through, someone with slight intelligence could make a case if they shut you down.

Read full topic
